Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 4ea7393642ac8d60b9476e65e78680199bd27786
I think we need to either get entity-manager support in for dimm vpd to host these objects based on vpd presence or use smbios-mdr tables like other x86 servers.

SMBIOS-MDR doesn't work with the new PECI interface exposed by the kernel. DIMM VPD parsing would be nice to have, but doesn't support DDR5 as of now, and it's unrelated to this change.

It's really about advertising the presence of inventory items. The presence is shown in the webui, used to do power-sequencing, loading/unloading drivers in entity-manager, parsing the PIROM ...

How about extending phosphor-multi-gpio-monitor to support dbus presence as well, similar to phosphor-gpio-presence?

I think the part I get confused on is that a part of what this commit is setting the presence of is dimms. But dimms have so much more information about them needed then presence. Part number, serial number, Capacity, ... So if we just set a dimm as present or not present based on a GPIO, where does all that other info come from? Using gpios to set a fan or some other device without vpd as present makes sense but I'm struggling with the more complex items that have VPD which could be read.

The 'Present' information can be used by other applications, for example entity-manager, that is designed to listen on DBUS objects.
As an example "Probe" would look like this:

"xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item({'PrettyName': 'DIMM C0C1', 'Present': true})

Entity-manager can then provide the necessary information to read and parse the VPD, for example bus numbers, addresses, drivers to be loaded...
Done
Maybe I'm missing something, but isn't this what phosphor-gpio-presence is for?  Why do we need to code this up as a bunch of assorted systemd services?

phosphor-gpio-presence only supports one GPIO per process and it uses the libevdev instead of libgpiod.
As there are 99 named GPIOs for presence we do not want to spawn 99 processes each mapping one GPIO to a "KEYCODE".

To me, ideally, just like gpio-multi-monitor was created to fix the deficiencies of and modernize gpio-monitor, I think a presence-multi-monitor could be created to fix the deficiencies of/modernize the original and handle multiple GPIOs with libgpiod.

> phosphor-gpio-presence only supports one GPIO per process and it uses the libevdev instead of libgpiod.
> As there are 99 named GPIOs for presence we do not want to spawn 99 processes each mapping one GPIO to a "KEYCODE".

Are you observing a problem with this?  Is it causing a real performance problem?  Or you just "don't like it"?

Rather than just workaround issues you find, it would be far more helpful to contribute solutions so others can benefit from it.

I've created https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-gpio-monitor/+/65940 ,
please review.
Reduced to 2 configuration files once https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-gpio-monitor/+/65940 is merged.
Any update on the change? Is it ready to be merged?
Waiting for Patrick to review.
sorry, I meant waiting for Patrick to review https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-gpio-monitor/+/65940
With https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/67171 merged, this should just be simplified to overriding the default file now
Done
As this is an append, it will just write over the existing file so a rm shouldn't be needed. But I don't see how it hurts anything either.
